Read benjamin moore list of colors with HEX code from colornerd


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
suppressMessages(library(tidyverse))

# Install and load the jsonlite package
if (!require(jsonlite)) install.packages("jsonlite")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Loading required package: jsonlite
```
:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```

Attaching package: 'jsonlite'
```
:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
The following object is masked from 'package:purrr':

    flatten
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
suppressMessages(library(jsonlite))

# Define the URL of the JSON file
#url <- "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wesbos/benjamin-moore-css/main/colors.json"
url <- "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/hakyim/benjamin-moore-css/main/colors.json"

# Read the JSON file from the URL
data <- fromJSON(url) %>% as_tibble()

# Find the properties of "Classic Gray"
classic_gray <- data %>% filter(name %in% c("Classic Gray","Gray Owl","Abalone"))

# Print the properties of "Classic Gray"
classic_gray %>% select(name, hex, number, family) %>% arrange(name)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

  name         hex    number  family 
  <chr>        <chr>  <chr>   <chr>  
1 Abalone      D3CFC7 2108-60 Gray   
2 Classic Gray E3E0D7 1548    Neutral
3 Classic Gray E3E0D7 OC-23   Gray   
4 Gray Owl     D3D4CC 2137-60 Neutral
5 Gray Owl     D3D4CC OC-52   Neutral
```
